snippet: As Major League Baseball attempts to clean up the steroid scourge it helped create, it has been assaulting players’ rights. And Alex Rodriguez is right to push back.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports Of The Times column holds that Alex Rodriguez may be accomplishing a great deal of good by challenging his suspension from baseball; argues that MLB has increasingly impinged on players' rights as it seeks to clean up the steroids scourge it helped create, and asserts that Rodriguez is right to push back.
lead_paragraph: As Major League Baseball attempts to clean up the steroid scourge it helped create, it has been assaulting players’ rights. And Alex Rodriguez is right to push back.

headline.main: Punishing Lords of Baseball Along With Their Fallen Idols
headline.print_headline: Punishing the Lords Along With Their Fallen Idols
